001package gust.backend.transport;
002
003import io.micronaut.aop.Introduction;
004import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Bean;
005import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Type;
006
007import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
008import java.lang.annotation.*;
009
010
011/**
012 * Specifies an injection qualifier for a managed transport supporting the service specified by this annotation.
013 *
014 * <p>To use this annotation, decorate a {@link io.grpc.ManagedChannel} parameter with <code>@GoogleAPIChannel</code>,
015 * and pass in the enumerated service you wish to receive a connection for. The connection will be initialized and kept
016 * in a pool according to current settings and load.</p>
017 *
018 * <p>For more information about how connections are managed and integrated with Micronaut,
019 * see {@link GoogleTransportManager}.</p>
020 *
021 * @see GoogleTransportManager
022 **/
023@Bean
024@Documented
025@Introduction
026@Target(ElementType.PARAMETER)
027@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
028@Type(GoogleTransportManager.class)
029public @interface GoogleAPIChannel {
030  /**
031   * Service for which this annotation is requesting a {@link io.grpc.ManagedChannel} instance.
032   *
033   * <p>If no connection to the requested service exists, one will be initialized before being handed back to the user.
034   * Otherwise, the user may get an existing singleton connection instance, or a connection instance from a pool of
035   * connections, depending on the implementing {@link TransportManager} (usually {@link GoogleTransportManager}).</p>
036   *
037   * @return Service to return a managed connection for.
038   */
039  @Nonnull GoogleService service();
040}
